title: Can't build with gobuild on Win7 even with -make=false
body:
I have a simple program W:\goeg\src\hello.go
But it won't build on Windows 7. I don't know if this is a bug or a mistake on my part.

W:\goeg\src\hello>set gopath=w:\goeg
W:\goeg\src\hello>%GOPATH%
'w:\goeg' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
W:\goeg\src\hello>goinstall -make=false .
goinstall: : path "W:\\goeg\\src\\hello" not inside a GOPATH

W:\goeg\src\hello>set gopath=\goeg
W:\goeg\src\hello>%GOPATH%
'\goeg' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
W:\goeg\src\hello>goinstall -make=false .
goinstall: : path "W:\\goeg\\src\\hello" not inside a GOPATH

It builds fine on Linux.
